name: catch
posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: catch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to take hold of something, especially something that is moving through the air

example.eg: I managed to catch the glass before it hit the ground.
example.egtrans: 我在玻璃杯落地之前接住了它。

example.eg: We saw the eagle swoop from the sky to catch its prey.
example.egtrans: 我们看到老鹰从空中猛扑下去抓捕猎物。

example.eg: Our dog ran past me and out of the house before I could catch it.
example.egtrans: 我们的狗从我身边跑过，我没抓住，让它跑出了屋子。

example.eg: He caught hold of my arm.
example.egtrans: 他一把抓住了我的胳膊。

example.eg: We placed saucepans on the floor to catch (= collect) the drops of water coming through the roof.
example.egtrans: 我们把平底锅放在地上接屋顶漏下的水。

example.eg: The batsman was caught (out) (= someone in the other team caught the ball when he hit it).
example.egtrans: 击球手击出的球被接住了。

dsense.name: catch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to find and stop a person or animal that is trying to escape

example.eg: Great pressure was put on the police to catch the terrorists as soon as possible.
example.egtrans: 警方面临着很大的压力，要尽早抓获恐怖分子。

example.eg: Two armed men were caught trying to cross the frontier at night.
example.egtrans: 两名武装分子企图在夜间越境时被抓获。

example.eg: They were happy because they had caught a lot of fish that day.
example.egtrans: 那天他们很高兴，因为抓到了很多鱼。

example.eg: I can see you're busy right now, so I'll catch you (= speak to you) later.
example.egtrans: 看得出你现在很忙，一会儿再跟你说。

dsense.name: catch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to discover, see, or realize something, especially someone doing something wrong

example.eg: He caught her reading his old love letters.
example.egtrans: 她看他过去的情书时被他撞见了。

example.eg: If the virus is caught (= discovered) in time, most patients can be successfully treated.
example.egtrans: 要是能及时发现病毒，大多数患者都可以治愈。

example.eg: I caught sight of/caught a glimpse of (= saw for a moment) a red coat in the crowd.
example.egtrans: 我在人群中看到／瞥见一个穿红色外套的人。

phrase.phrase_title: catch sb's attention, imagination, interest, etc.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to make someone notice something and feel interested
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 引起…的注意（想象，兴趣等）

example.eg: A ship out at sea caught his attention.
example.egtrans: 一艘出海的船吸引了他的注意。

example.eg: Her pictures caught my imagination.
example.egtrans: 她的照片引起了我的遐想。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to not have something, especially when it is needed
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: （尤指在需要的时候）没有，缺乏

example.eg: He doesn't like to be caught without any biscuits in the house.
example.egtrans: 他喜欢家里备些饼干。

phrase.phrase_title: you won't catch sb doing sth

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: said to mean that you will certainly not see someone doing a particular thing or in a particular place

example.eg: You won't catch me at work after four o'clock.
example.egtrans: 别指望我4点以后工作。

example.eg: You won't catch Carla eating in a cheap restaurant, oh no.
example.egtrans: 卡拉不可能在便宜的餐馆吃饭，不可能的。

dsense.name: catch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to travel or be able to travel on an aircraft, train, bus, etc.
trans_examp.trans_cn: 赶，乘，搭乘（飞机、火车、公共汽车等）

example.eg: He always catches the 10.30 a.m. train to work.
example.egtrans: 他总是乘上午10点30分的那班火车上班。

example.eg: She was worried that she'd arrive too late to catch the last bus home.
example.egtrans: 她担心到得太晚，赶不上回家的末班车。

dsense.name: catch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to get an illness, especially one caused by bacteria or a virus
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指因感染细菌或病毒）患（病），染（疾）

example.eg: He caught a cold on holiday.
example.egtrans: 他度假时患了感冒。

example.eg: A lot of children in the school caught measles last term.
example.egtrans: 上学期许多在校的孩子得了麻疹。

dsense.name: catch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to stick somewhere, or to make something stick somewhere

example.eg: The sleeve of my jacket (got) caught on the door handle and ripped.
example.egtrans: 我的夹克衫的袖子钩在了门把手上，给扯破了。

example.eg: Her hair got caught (up) in her hairdryer.
example.egtrans: 她的头发缠在了吹风机上。

dsense.name: catch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to manage to be in time to see or do something

example.eg: I went home early to catch the beginning of the programme.
example.egtrans: 为了看到节目的开头，我就稍微早了一点回家。

example.eg: You'll have to run if you want to catch the post (= send a letter before the post has been collected).
example.egtrans: 要是你想赶得上寄信，就得赶紧了。

dsense.name: catch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

example.eg: I couldn't catch what the announcer said, with all the other noise going on.
example.egtrans: 这么吵，我听不清播音员在说什么。

dsense.name: catch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to hit something, especially without intending to

example.eg: His head caught the edge of the table as he fell.
example.egtrans: 他摔倒的时候头撞到了桌子边。

example.eg: Medical teams were caught in the crossfire of the opposing armies.
example.egtrans: 医疗队陷入了敌军的交叉火力中。

dsense.name: catch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to become involved in something, often without wanting to

example.eg: They were having an argument and somehow I got caught up in it.
example.egtrans: 他们在争论，不知怎地把我给卷了进去。

dsense.name: catch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to stop breathing for a moment, or to begin to breathe correctly again after running or other exercise
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 屏住呼吸；（跑步或运动后）调整呼吸

example.eg: I had to sit down and catch my breath.
example.egtrans: 我只好坐下喘口气。

dsense.name: catch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If you have caught the sun, the sun has made your skin a slightly darker brown or red colour.

example.eg: You've caught the sun on the back of your neck.
example.egtrans: 你脖子后面晒黑了。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If something catches the light, a light shines on it and makes it look shiny.
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 被光照射；在光照下闪闪发亮

dsense.name: catch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

example.eg: This wood's too wet, the fire won't catch.
example.egtrans: 木头太湿，点不着。

example.eg: For reasons which are not yet known, the factory caught fire late yesterday evening.
example.egtrans: 昨晚工厂失火，原因尚不清楚。

name: catch
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: catch
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 隐藏的问题；暗藏的不利因素

example.eg: Free food? It sounds too good to be true. What's the catch?
example.egtrans: 免费食物？这么好的事，不像是真的。这里面有什么蹊跷？

dsense.name: catch
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

example.eg: The fishermen were disappointed with their catch that day.
example.egtrans: 渔夫们不满意当天的收获。

trans_examp.trans_en: a person who is considered to be very suitable for a relationship

example.eg: Her new boyfriend's not much of a catch really, is he?
example.egtrans: 她的新男朋友和她不太般配，是吧？

dsense.name: catch
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a small device on a door, window, bag, etc. that keeps it fastened

dsense.name: catch
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a feeling of stiffness in part of your body

example.eg: She would complain of catch in the joints during winter.
example.egtrans: 冬天的时候她会说自己关节僵硬。
